hook.text: On January 9, 2007, Steve Jobs pulled a glass rectangle from his pocket and changed everything.

buildup.text: He said Apple was releasing three products: a phone, a music player, and an internet device.

discovery.text: Then he paused. 'These are not three devices. This is one device.' The crowd erupted.

twist.text: Competitors laughed. A phone with no keyboard? No business customer would want it.

climax.text: Apple sold a million iPhones in 74 days. Within five years, smartphones outsold all others.

punchline.text: One product killed the keyboard and built the modern world.

quiz.question: What was unique about Steve Jobs' iPhone announcement?
options: He announced three separate products that were actually one device
He gave away free iPhones to the audience
